column4: can I set Remote Desktop on my ubuntu, and access it from another computer ?
Yes, you can
10x. how can I do that?
You should see configuration under System -> Preferences -> Remote Desktop
if you don't, then there's just a small package you need to install called 'vino'
10q very much
Ubuntu uses a protocol called VNC for remote desktop. It's not supported by the Windows Remote Desktop application, but it's very well supported otherwise; there are dozens of clients for it
yeah I know vnc
but I wanted to know if it's possible to do it with rdp as well
btw, if we're talking about it already, do you know what's the diff between rdp and rdp v5 ?
Not from a feature-level, no
oh wait, does it mean that if I use the ubuntu Remote Desktop feature, then I can't connect to it using windows Remote Desktop?
That's what I said, yes
RDP is a proprietary protocol; I *have* seen a linux server for it, but it's a very, very long way from ready to release
got it. 10x
can you help in another question I have ?
I don't know yet...
how can I set a share on my ubuntu, that will be accessable from other computers on my network?
System -> Admninistration -> Shared Folders :-)
hmm.. right, forgot that one. but I do want to learn how to do it, the terminal way.. :-) which means, configuring the samba manually
Google is your friend, there. It would take me a *long* time to explain that here
thought so. no easy shortcuts there :-)  10x again man
